nbi.documentation: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus

nbi.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

nbi.code.library.documentation: List of external libraries used by the code that has produced this IDS

nbi.code.library[:].parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

nbi.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

nbi.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

nbi.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

nbi.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

nbi.ids_properties.creation_date.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

nbi.ids_properties.homogeneous_time.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

nbi.ids_properties.occurrence.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

nbi.ids_properties.provenance.node.documentation: Set of IDS nodes for which the provenance is given. The provenance information applies to the whole structure below the IDS node. For documenting provenance information for the whole IDS, set the size of this array of structure to 1 and leave the child "path" node empty

nbi.ids_properties.provenance.node[:].pa.documentation: Path of the node within the IDS, following the syntax given in the link below. If empty, means the provenance information applies to the whole IDS.

nbi.ids_properties.provenance.node[:].so.documentation: List of sources used to import or calculate this node, identified as explained below. In case the node is the result of of a calculation / data processing, the source is an input to the process described in the "code" structure at the root of the IDS. The source can be an IDS (identified by a URI or a persitent identifier, see syntax in the link below) or non-IDS data imported directly from an non-IMAS database (identified by the command used to import the source, or the persistent identifier of the data source). Often data are obtained by a chain of processes, however only the last process input are recorded here. The full chain of provenance has then to be reconstructed recursively from the provenance information contained in the data sources.

nbi.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

nbi.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...). Superseeded by the new provenance structure.

nbi.ids_properties.version_put.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS

nbi.ids_properties.version_put.access_la.documentation: Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS

nbi.ids_properties.version_put.data_dict.documentation: Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS

nbi.latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between input command received from the RT network and actuator starting to react. Applies globally to the system described by this IDS unless specific latencies (e.g. channel-specific or antenna-specific) are provided at a deeper level in the IDS structure.

nbi.latency_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "latency"

nbi.unit.documentation: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually.

nbi.unit[:].aperture.documentation: Description of a set of collimating apertures through which the beam is launched

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].centre.phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].centre.phi_error.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "phi"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].centre.r_error_i.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].centre.z_error_i.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].geometry_type.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Do NOT repeat the first point.

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].outline.x1_error.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x1"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].outline.x2_error.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x2"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].radius_error_ind.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "radius"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].surface.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].surface_error_in.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "surface"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x1_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x1_unit_vector.x.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x1_unit_vector.y.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x1_unit_vector.z.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x1_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x1_width_error_i.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x1_width"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x2_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x2_unit_vector.x.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x2_unit_vector.y.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x2_unit_vector.z.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x2_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x2_width_error_i.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x2_width"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x3_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x3_unit_vector.x.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x3_unit_vector.y.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

nbi.unit[:].aperture[:].x3_unit_vector.z.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

nbi.unit[:].beam_current_fraction.documentation: Fractions of beam current distributed among the different energies, the first index corresponds to the fast neutrals energy (1:full, 2: half, 3: one third)

nbi.unit[:].beam_current_fraction.data_e.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

nbi.unit[:].beam_power_fraction.documentation: Fractions of beam power distributed among the different energies, the first index corresponds to the fast neutrals energy (1:full, 2: half, 3: one third)

nbi.unit[:].beam_power_fraction.data_err.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group.documentation: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].angle.documentation: Angle of inclination between a beamlet at the centre of the injection unit surface and the horiontal plane

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].angle_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "angle"

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].beamlets.a.documentation: Angle of inclination between a line at the centre of a beamlet and the horizontal plane, for each beamlet
Index in the error_description list for "angles"

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].beamlets.p.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"
Fraction of power of a unit injected by each beamlet
Index in the error_description list for "power_fractions"

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].beamlets.t.documentation: Tangency radius (major radius where the central line of a beamlet is tangent to a circle around the torus), for each beamlet
Index in the error_description list for "tangency_radii"

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].direction.documentation: Direction of the beam seen from above the torus: -1 = clockwise; 1 = counter clockwise

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].divergence.documentation: Detailed information on beamlet divergence. Divergence is described as a superposition of Gaussian components with amplitide "particles_fraction" and vertical/horizontal divergence. Note that for positive ion NBI the divergence is well described by a single Gaussian

The horiztonal beamlet divergence of the component. Here the divergence is defined for Gaussian beams as the angel where the beam density is reduced by a factor 1/e compared to the maximum density. For non-Gaussian beams the divergence is sqrt(2)*mean((x-mean(x))**2), where x is the angle and the mean should be performed over the beam density, P(x): mean(y)=int(y*P(x)*dx).
Index in the error_description list for "horizontal"
Fraction of injected particles in the component
Index in the error_description list for "particles_fraction"

The vertical beamlet divergence of the component. Here the divergence is defined for Gaussian beams as the angel where the beam density is reduced by a factor 1/e compared to the maximum density. For non-Gaussian beams the divergence is sqrt(2)*mean((x-mean(x))**2), where x is the angle and the mean should be performed over the beam density, P(x): mean(y)=int(y*P(x)*dx).
Index in the error_description list for "vertical"

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].focus.documentation: Describes how the beamlet group is focused

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].focus.foca.documentation: Horizontal focal length along the beam line, i.e. the point along the centre of the beamlet-group where the beamlet-group has its minimum horizontal width
Index in the error_description list for "focal_length_horizontal"
Vertical focal length along the beam line, i.e. the point along the centre of the beamlet-group where the beamlet-group has its minimum vertical width
Index in the error_description list for "focal_length_vertical"

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].focus.widt.documentation: The horizontal width of the beamlets group at the at the horizontal focal point
Index in the error_description list for "width_min_horizontal"
The vertical width of the beamlets group at the at the vertical focal point
Index in the error_description list for "width_min_vertical"

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].position.documentation: R, Z, Phi position of the beamlet group centre

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].position.p.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].position.r.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r"

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].position.z.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].tangency_r.documentation: Tangency radius (major radius where the central line of a NBI unit is tangent to a circle around the torus)
Index in the error_description list for "tangency_radius"

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].tilting.documentation: In case of dynamic beam tilting (i.e. during the pulse), e.g. for some Beam Emission Spectroscopy use cases, variations of position, tangency radius and angle with respect to their static value, for various time slices

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].tilting[:].documentation: Variation of the angle of inclination between a beamlet at the centre of the injection unit surface and the horiontal plane
Index in the error_description list for "delta_angle"
Variation of the position of the beamlet group centre
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"
Variation of the tangency radius (major radius where the central line of a NBI unit is tangent to a circle around the torus)
Index in the error_description list for "delta_tangency_radius"

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].width_hori.documentation: Horizontal width of the beam group at the injection unit surface (or grounded grid)
Index in the error_description list for "width_horizontal"

nbi.unit[:].beamlets_group[:].width_vert.documentation: Vertical width of the beam group at the injection unit surface (or grounded grid)
Index in the error_description list for "width_vertical"

nbi.unit[:].energy.documentation: Full energy of the injected species (acceleration of a single atom)

nbi.unit[:].energy.data_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

nbi.unit[:].power_launched.documentation: Power launched from this unit into the vacuum vessel

nbi.unit[:].power_launched.data_error_in.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

nbi.unit[:].source.documentation: Description of the surface of the ion source from which the beam is extracted

nbi.unit[:].source.centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

nbi.unit[:].source.centre.phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

nbi.unit[:].source.centre.phi_error_inde.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "phi"

nbi.unit[:].source.centre.r_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r"

nbi.unit[:].source.centre.z_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

nbi.unit[:].source.geometry_type.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

nbi.unit[:].source.outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Do NOT repeat the first point.

nbi.unit[:].source.outline.x1_error_inde.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x1"

nbi.unit[:].source.outline.x2_error_inde.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x2"

nbi.unit[:].source.radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2

nbi.unit[:].source.radius_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "radius"

nbi.unit[:].source.surface.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data

nbi.unit[:].source.surface_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "surface"

nbi.unit[:].source.x1_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

nbi.unit[:].source.x1_unit_vector.x_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"

nbi.unit[:].source.x1_unit_vector.y_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

nbi.unit[:].source.x1_unit_vector.z_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

nbi.unit[:].source.x1_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3

nbi.unit[:].source.x1_width_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x1_width"

nbi.unit[:].source.x2_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

nbi.unit[:].source.x2_unit_vector.x_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"

nbi.unit[:].source.x2_unit_vector.y_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

nbi.unit[:].source.x2_unit_vector.z_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

nbi.unit[:].source.x2_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3

nbi.unit[:].source.x2_width_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x2_width"

nbi.unit[:].source.x3_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

nbi.unit[:].source.x3_unit_vector.x_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"

nbi.unit[:].source.x3_unit_vector.y_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

nbi.unit[:].source.x3_unit_vector.z_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

nbi.unit[:].species.a_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "a"

nbi.unit[:].species.label.documentation: String identifying the species (e.g. H, D, T, ...)

nbi.unit[:].species.z_n_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z_n"
